item.title: Fox pushes Cameron’s Avatar back to Dec ‘09
item.description: 20th Century Fox, the studio in charge of James Cameron's Avatar rearranged their 2009 release schedule, moving Avatar from it's original June 22nd release date to December 18, 2009. Fox stated the reason for the change was to allow for more Post-Production time to finish the film in time for release. The also stated that there were [...]

item.title: Silvaticus 3015 to film in Wellington next year
item.description: A new sci-fi film called Silvaticus 3015 has been added to the growing list of Sci-Fi films being shot here. Los Angeles independent movie company Hawk Eye Studios will be filming the NZ$109m epic in Wellington late next year. The film is set more than 500 years into the future and follows the story of survivors from [...]

item.title: Fonterra Santa
item.description:
I was never a demanding child when it came to Christmas. I never asked for anything that my parents could not afford.

Such low expectations have meant of course that a non-inflationary adjusted $200 in a card is presented to me every year. Now $200 is great when you are 12 years old. But twenty years later? Well even Cullen makes inflation adjustments. And NOC's presents now come to more than mine. She's six.

So this year I will be raising the expectational stakes to something more fitting of an adult. I'd quite like this:




Their reported earnings being well over $800K, I suspect there will be plenty of children of Fonterra's Santa lining up for likewise.

item.title: Closing the Gap
item.description:
Recent studies have indicated that the Average Australian income is 30% higher than the Average New Zealand Income. What this means is that New Zealand lags so far behind Australia that it will take a quarter of a century of slightly higher growth to catch up to Australian incomes.
The table below shows that if New Zealand's average income grew at 4%, and Australia's at only 3%, in 2032 the

item.title: La révolution est arrivée! La victoire du marché libre!
item.description:
French President Nicolas Sarkozy has started cutting the bloated french civil service with an annoucement that a third of civil servants who retire next year will not be replaced, rising to 50% the following years. Also announced are reductions in pension benefits for civil servants (including members of the National Assembly).
Already, some unions are threatening to strike over the cuts. These

Drug pushers target kids with lollipops as BZP Bill delayed
The Bill to classify BZP as a Class C1 drug will not now be passed until early in the new year, Associate Minister of Health Jim Anderton said today.

item.description: I've heard suggestions that I haven't got a brain, and if I did I've never used it. I know, I've heard you. But me baby, I've got statistics, I've got facts. I've got pictures. Herewith the shocking evidence: actual picture proof that I both have a brain and, from those few splodges of colour there, that I sometimes even use it. Frightening, isn't it. Newspapers opposing the party line have been refused press credentials, and distinguished scientists from Africa, Australia, India,

item.title: Buy a Fireman a beer!
item.description:
I can't praise those unpaid volunteers enough!

I was one of the first on the scene of a nasty crash an hour ago. The vehicle had hit a power pole, the driver was badly injured and the ute was on fire.

With my extinguisher and another from another first-aider we kept the fire down, but could not extinguish it.

The driver was trapped and there was no way we could get her out.

It was a real relief to see that fire crew arrive, just as the engine was starting to flare up, as we were near out of options!

Update:

Story here:

item.title: peteremcc
item.description:
Should NZ First have given its election money to Starship not taxpayers?
That's what the Herald are asking in their latest "Your Views" question.

Reading the responses is fantastic.
Most people think that it is taxpayer's money and NZ First are wrong to not pay it pack.
The rest seem to be the ones who realise it wouldn't go back to 'taxpayers' but back into the government/labour's coffers and consider Starship more worthy!
I'm not sure which argument I prefer...

Next year's election is going to be great, but maybe not for Winston.

item.title: The US election...
item.description:
You can find out which candidate is closest to your views if you click on this survey.

Closest to me is Rudy Guiliani, which doesn't surprise me all that much.

Second though is Hilary Clinton, which is a surprise, especially when the survey concludes I'm a 'moderate libertarian'. (The label is not one I'd choose but its probably not that far off).

This from the NZ Herald _________________________________________________ As many as 77 per cent of parents aged 25 in a study said they had smacked children, with 12 per cent admitting they severely assaulted a child in the past year. The data was gathered as part of a Christchurch Health and Development Study and reported in the

item.title: Young Communist League, USA
item.description:
At the post office yesterday I was once again bemused to see symbols and language of Communism being used to sell a product. The image of Che Guevara, the communist star, etc....'Call your comrade in Cuba' it said.

And now, I was just on the Young Communist League USA website. The top link invites us to purge the bourgeois go shopping!
'Skip the usual holiday consumerism and buy your friends and family YCL gear! With have something for everyone- from our "Capitalism Sucks" and "iVote" t-shirts, to buttons to subscriptions to our magazine, Dynamic. No need to stand in long lines, you can order now from our online store.'

They need a new communications person -
- Skip consumerism by *buying* from us!
- They offer a choice of goods - "something for everyone"
- "No need to stand in long lines" like you would for bread under an alternative economic order!

Well I guess they get some points for not accepting AmEx...
Tips to: Act Jack for passing that one on!

item.title: Douglas to Dancing
item.description:
From Douglas To Dancing is a new blog written ALLLL about my beloved ACT Party. Written by Geoffrey Miller, an Otago honors student.

His honors dissertation, also called 'Douglas to Dancing' is in the pipes now. Indeed, he's just had a report on it from on high. The title of course refers to the beginnings with Roger Douglas (whome I blogged about a few days ago) and the latest greatest achievement of ACT recognition, signified by leader Rodney Hide's televised dancing achivements.

I think he's a bit of a punk. Let's keep an eye on him.

item.title: Shadbolt threat to topple Govt
item.description:
Shadbolt threat to topple Govt - Invercargill Mayor Tim Shadbolt says he will fight to bring down the Government if funding to the Southern Institute of Technology is cut.
The Government will announce today how much money universities, polytechnics and other tertiary... [NZ Politics]

Tim Shadbolt, someone I have no time for, is mad, real mad. He is going to campaign to bring the government down.....well he will be able to place a couple of ads in the paper to do so because he will be limited to $120,000.

Unless of course he follows is Vietnam War protesting days and willfully breaks the law.

item.description:

item.title: Southerly: I've Turned Gay for Public Address
item.description:
I've been gay for about three hours now -- and, frankly, I wish I'd done it years ago.

The raison d'être for my change in sexual preference is, of course, the departure of Tze Ming Mok. Her exit made Public Address thirty-three per cent less representative of women, and one hundred per cent less representative of New Zealand Arts Foundation laureates. Bang went our reputation for diversity...

item.title: Radiation: And the Shortie killer is ...
item.description:
... I’m picking … Joey.

… who will stalk Tania. He’s behind you! Also, next year, Chris Warner is bumped off in a car crash, Toni inherits all the money and she, Guy, Tuesday and Harry move back into Warner Towers, where Guy proceeds to spend all the money on drugs. Shanti and Scotty have a totally Bollywood wedding, just because it would be fun. Before that, Shanti’s betrothed arrives from India and is totally gay and he and Gerald have a thing...

item.title: OnPoint: Terra Firma
item.description: Over dinner on Monday, Jon and I got into a rather sombre conversation about the last days of Hemingway, which he spent in Ketchum, Idaho. When the similarly doomed Hunter S Thompson retraced Hemingway's footsteps – right to the very last – he came to the conclusion that he was, like Hemingway, no longer connected to the zeitgeist. His life as a writer had, therefore, finished...

item.title: Busytown: Pavlova Paradise
item.description: So bai bai, Tze Ming, or should that be twe meh naw? You went through this place like a dose of the salts, in a good way. I will miss your brilliant prose, your assiduous non-taking of prisoners, and your (ahem) scouring wit. It already feels quiet and, dare I say it, a little boring without you. ...

item.title: Google Adsense URL Channels - Very Convenient
item.description:
I just noticed this morning when updating some details in Google Adsense, that you can create new channels, and simply assign URLs to them. Use the same Adsense ID on all your websites, and Google does all the hard work in splitting the stats and earning details by site.

Not sure how long thats been around, but very cool nonetheless.

item.title: Air New Zealand Grab a plane
item.description:
Ok, let's get into this game... One of our moderators, Steve Biddle, has created a "Geekzone flight" in the latest Air New Zealand promotion Grab a plane.

You can join the Geekzone flight now - full planes go in the draw to win the flight to anywhere in New Zealand for a full day - for everyone in the plane. The flight plan is Wellington - Dunedin. so if you join the flight, be prepared to depart from Wellington.

You can also create your own flight to other destinations.

Year 9 “What do I have to do to get into Classics?”
Me “Well, Classics is a Year 13 subject, so you’re a good couple of years away from that being an issue.”
Year 9 “Yeah, but what do I need to get into it in Year 13?”
Me “Well, you have three years in which to not make me angry – basically, that is the sole entry requirement.”
Year 9 “I’m a good student, and I never make you angry.”
Me “See, that’s a lie, which makes me angry. You haven’t gotten off to a good start...”

item.title: Google and accounting…
item.description:
With a hat tip to a clean shaven Mike, this post over on RWW surmises that an online accounting system might be in the pipline from Google. The rationale for the idea of Google entering this space is pretty much the rationale for them entering every space - eyeballs, data and stickiness.

If we look however at who Google are - they are predominantly a mass market player - as such they're keen to get the maximum number of eyeballs in any one particular space.

With that in mind, I'm picking that Google will launch a financial offering, but it'll be more along the lines of "Google your money" than "Google business money". I'm picturing home budgeting (obvious advertising fit there ) and cashflow. Some nice calculators to work stuff out and the like. All these things can be rolled out pretty globally without customisation, accounting is much more location specific and not completely within the current Google model.

I'm sure they do have people looking at the business accounting space but I don't see it happening in the near future... but then again I could be wrong. I wonder if Xero feel like commenting on the possibiilty?

item.title: Free Home Makeover
item.description: A new reality television show is offering to help you declutter your home and give it a stylish new look. If your home is cluttered, lacks storage and is in need of a new look, then a new TV home show can help you for free. All they need is your time and willingness to participate. Experts will help you to get organised, streamline your home, and turn it into the sanctuary you’ve always dreamed of. Along with the completed form, please send of a photo of the people in your household, as well as photos of each room, and the house’s exterior. Delivery details of where to send your form and photos are on the application form. For more information email The Factory TV or phone 09-376-9963. Related Stories: Click here for other opportunities to be on TV game shows, competitions and reality TV

item.title: Apply now for Deal or No Deal 2008
item.description:
TV3 and Imagination TV are inviting applications for the next series of Deal or No Deal to air in 2008.

To apply you must be 18 years of age or older and a NZ resident. Head on over to TV3 to fill out the application form. Remember you will be judged on your application, so the more personality you can put into it, the better your chances are of being selected!

Related Stories:
Click here for other opportunities to be on TV game shows, competitions and reality TV

item.title: Be On Property Challenge
item.description:
Cream Media is taking the Kiwi zeal for property trading and turning it into a reality television show.

Two Kiwi couples will be given a start-up house. The goal is to be the first to trade their way up to their dream home, renovating four houses to come close to the million dollar mark.

For each house the couples have at their disposal a renovation budget.

If you've been wondering lately how you'll ever make it into the property market, this could be your chance. This is a competition of skill and planning.

The winning couple will be lavishly rewarded with an abundance of prizes.

Click here for the application form for Property Challenge

Click here for other opportunities to be on TV.

Wake up, promoters, that's just shabby. I was talking with a mate who told me about going to see some hiphop MCs in New York, and they heard the show

item.title: First reading of The Christmas Bill
item.description:
Stocking fillers all MP's could ever want and wish for is listed by Vernon Small.

Some classics are;
  • Taito - one night in Bangkok on a tiling course
  • Helen - a fourth term and older MSM hacks
  • Winnie - a compliant media, reporting the real facts as written in a Winnie diktat
  • Michael - just one more budget
  • Bill - a big non-inflationary tax cut
  • Phil - an A4 buyer
  • Chris - NCEA spell checker
  • Jeannette - more bloody bus lanes
  • Jim - a retirement date
  • Tau - a mouthguard
  • Margaret - peace in her time
  • and Hugh - a spin doctor
Full detail can be found here.

ps: Wonder if 17 white A4's show up against the Woodbourne brown on Google Earth - too slow on dialup to have a squiz - at least a potential buyer could now see what is actually being hocked off.

item.title: The chasm starts to open?
item.description:
In a move sure to really annoy the Minister of Baubles, the party exec has requested that all 7 NZ First MP's vote against the EFB. Seems the word from the party faithfull is no go on restrictions on freedom of speech, even if costs you your place in the trough. Some one else with some ethics over this matter.
the bill was not supported within the party and that the caucus was supporting it because it would help their own survival.

This will be interesting. At least Liarbour will have a scapegoat if the bill does not pass.

Is that devil or the deep blue sea I spy?

item.title: Beer Haiku - Beer by Committee
item.description:
Writing about the Collaborator Doppelbock, Captain Hops aptly captures the problem with beers designed by a committee in today's Beer Haiku.
Brewed by committee. How many are too many Cooks in the kitchen?
Glass tip - As ever, Beer Haiku Daily
Our Beer in the Media Watch section is occupied for the second week in a row by the Education Review. Tom Reece, the Chief Executive of the Extractives

item.title: Phone bits
item.description:
Two interesting phone/email bits today.

Apple working on improved Exchange support for iPhone

Probably via Active Sync. Wonder if Apple have licensed that yet? Though they could use WebDav ala Entourage.

Telecom to do BlackBerry's

I had heard that Voda had the NZ rights to BB (if there is such a thing) so I wonder if the 'WorldMode' wording is important.

If iPhone plays nicely with Exchange is BlackBerry moot anyway? With iPhone push email what happens to RIM?

Roll on 2008. It's shaping up to be a big year.

item.title: Giveaway — Tickets to Mercury Rising 07
item.description:
Katchafire -- one of the headline acts at Mercury Rising 07

As if our Gold Coast giveaway wasn't enough, Spare Room is offering readers the chance to win two tickets (2 x GA tickets with a parking permit) to Mercury Rising 07, this New Years Eve at Whitianga on The Coromandel Peninsula...

item.title: Open Letter to my Clients
item.description:
Dear Clients,

As you know I have no problem with you booking your own bands, and in fact will encourage it as it's just less shit for me to deal with. There is however one thing you should keep in mind. When you originally saw the band playing and had a great time, you were probably drunk.

So, tomorrow morning when you are all nursing your hangovers and muttering to yourselves, "I danced to that!", remember, YOU booked them.

This has to be the worst sound check I have ever had to endure. Lucky me though as I get to leave before they fully crank up for the night.

Love
Unpclesbian

item.title: Dropkicks Job Available
item.description:
One of the Wellingtonista's sibling blogs (and podcast), the Dropkicks, are looking for a woman to join their team.

Applicants will need to:

  1. Live in Wellington.
  2. Have a good knowledge of sports both local and worldwide. But not too good a knowledge, just at least as good as theirs…i.e. can make stuff up if needed.
  3. Be funny, or be able to enjoy a good laugh (and be able to put up with your favourite sports team being made fun of)
  4. Put up with us and their inane banter, while hav­ing the ability to create your own (see point 2)
  5. Have one night a week free to record the cast (usually a Monday)
  6. Be a woman of the female persuasion

If you think that you might be interested in joining their "dynamic and energetic team" then pop on over and check them out.

item.title: best cities... wtf?
item.description:
Usually website related pissing contests (Hot Or Not; Rate My, [er...] Kitteh etc etc ad infinitum) are inherently dull.

But maybe not so dull if you are former Wellingtonian, now Münchener mad-genius developer Ben Nolan.

His Best Cities Facebook application did, for a tiny golden moment, have Wellington in the top spot. Which means of course that this pissing contest is now of interest to us, too!

Unfortunately, Facebook being the kind of random, viral place that it is, the app has been seized upon by at least two distinct regional groups each competing within each other parochially for the title of best city.

The upshot of all this is that towns like Slavonski Brod, a no doubt quite lovely town with a rather pulchritudinous population but not much larger than Invercargill, is the world's fifth best city, with Wellington relegated to 15th.

This is clearly not good enough. Get to it. peeps!

item.title: Shadbolt threatens Government
item.description:
The Invercargill Mayor is quoted in the Herald:

Mr Shadbolt said a proposed $8 million cut for the institute would lead to a loss of 1400 students and be bad for the region.

"This is a direct attack on everything we've done and everything we've achieved in the last five years and we're not going to stop on Friday and say, 'Oh well, that's the end of it'," he told Radio New Zealand.

"There's an election coming up and we'll be doing everything we possibly can. We're going to launch a campaign to bring down this Government if they are going to launch a campaign to bring down our province."

Except sadly for Tim and Invercargill, their campaign will be limited to $120,000.

item.title: Deforestation
item.description:
National has just done a press release highlighting the hypocrisy of David Parker preaching overseas about the need to end global deforestation, when their own policies in NZ have led to deforestation

“Deforestation in New Zealand will top six million trees this year. This comes on top of losses of three million trees in 2004, 2005, and 2006. New Zealand planted more trees than it felled for every year from 1951, when records began, until 2003.

Deforestation contributes to global warming, so goes totally against the rhetoric of carbon neutrality.  Anyway I thought I would make a graph out of the data with the PR about net planted forest area.

Another case of all rhetoric, and no action.  Actually in this case it is worse than inaction.  Their actions have caused a 50 year trend of expanding forests to slow and then reverse.

item.title: Around the blogs
item.description:
Steven Price has an interesting post about Dom Post editor Tim Pankhurst's address
to the journalism conference. I wanted to attend that conference but was too busy.

Poneke celebrates the demise on the anti-Jewish League of Rights.

Miramar Mike blogs on the launch of Google Maps in NZ (yay)

item.title: bookmooch
item.description:
i have discovered the joys of bookmooch.com

List the books you have, but no longer want -- and then go request books from other people. It's a points based system. I sent a few books off to people for free (i paid postage) and now i have points. I then requested some books from elsewhere, and they arrive to me!

This be the books i don't want:
http://bookmooch.com/m/inventory/br3nda

item.title: Out to get me, thin
item.description:
I have this sneaking suspicion that New World (yes, the supermarket) is saying something about my current physique. Every time I go there to get one of their award-winning steak and cheese pies (made with actual bits of steak!) they are "out" or "not doing them today". This causes me to turn around and get a healthy sandwich from the make-a-sandwich-bar thingy behind me.

I know what you're trying to tell me. Bastards!

item.title: Nothing in common? Perfect
item.description: In this week’s issue: Nothing in common? Perfect, dazed and bemused, soothing vibrations, hey dad cn u pls text me that mp3 and those pix and 5 hundy? Cheers, taxing the taxi, beauty on the inside, Christmas lessons, last and least with a little bit of yeast and quote of the week

item.title: Open Letter to my Clients
item.description:
Dear Clients,

As you know I have no problem with you booking your own bands, and in fact will encourage it as it's just less shit for me to deal with. There is however one thing you should keep in mind. When you originally saw the band playing and had a great time, you were probably drunk.

So, tomorrow morning when you are all nursing your hangovers and muttering to yourselves, "I danced to that!", remember, YOU booked them.

This has to be the worst sound check I have ever had to endure. Lucky me though as I get to leave before they fully crank up for the night.

Love
Unpclesbian

You are nothing short of a windbag.

item.title: NZ First hypocrisy exposed fully
item.description:
Kiwiblog » Blog Archive » NZ First on Electoral Reform

Winston likes to think and constantly intones that his party is the only one with integrity. Perhaps he mutters under his breath whenever he says this "...of a whore".

DPF has exposed his and his party's hypocrisy for all to see.

Winston First supporters should hang their heads in shame.

item.title: Shadbolt threat to topple Govt
item.description:
Shadbolt threat to topple Govt - Invercargill Mayor Tim Shadbolt says he will fight to bring down the Government if funding to the Southern Institute of Technology is cut.
The Government will announce today how much money universities, polytechnics and other tertiary... [NZ Politics]

Tim Shadbolt, someone I have no time for, is mad, real mad. He is going to campaign to bring the government down.....well he will be able to place a couple of ads in the paper to do so because he will be limited to $120,000.

Unless of course he follows is Vietnam War protesting days and willfully breaks the law.

item.title: Early Christmas presents and Labour’s pains
item.description:
This will have to be a brief post since my wife is going into labour and I need to finish my cartoon for tomorrow as soon as possible. Yikes! No pressure, eh? Fortunately there's lots of good material to choose from.

We're planning to have a home birth, so I'll be around the house throughout the day, popping in and out from my studio. We had our last child at home too, and I was working at the Nelson Mail at the time. I remember finishing at 11am as soon as the paper went to press, then racing home on my bike as Fran's contractions were getting stronger and more frequent. By 1:30pm we had a new addition to our family. Talk about good timing!

Anyway, here are some new pics. Wish us all luck ...

item.title: Sexy in the City
item.description:
Sex and the City would by far be one of the most inspirational television programmes on the airwaves today. Who could resist a life living in uptown New York, wearing couture to get coffee, buying Manolos when you're down and partying with the best-looking people in town? Not to mention your job is to casually write about life in general, to pay for your penthouse suite apartment in the hottest part of NYC.

But let's be real here. Not many of us can pop down the road and do such things. I mean, they don't even sell Manolos here!

But luckily - to complement the launch of the new Sex and the City movie, Miami-based lingerie label Cosabella has just done a deal with HBO to release two Sex and the City underwear collections next year.

The first collection will be available in stores in April for the launch of the movie, and the second will go on sale later on in the year once the DVD version of the film debuts.

Hey - I like the fact that they're trying to include the public in a small piece of their extravagant life. Sure they won't sell it here (along with everything else that we don't have), but for some lucky few you can feel like Carrie Bradshaw every day.

item.title: OMG!!! Deenz iz teh AWSUMIST!!!
item.description:
While the official announcement isn't until 3pm NZ time, Stuff has already (prematurely?) creamed themselves to tell everyone that Robbie Deans will be the new Wallabies coach.

Won't they look silly if it actually turns out to be David Nucifora (which it won't).

So now that Knuckles is gone what nickname are we gonna give Deans? Comentz pleez

item.title: You asked for it Auckland
item.description:
From The Herald:

The Auckland City Council has scrapped its plan to build affordable housing.

The last council signed a contract with the New Zealand housing Trust to build 100 homes for lower income families.

The contract was worth $9 million.

Mayor John Banks says it was a pet-project with the last council and one he did not agree with.

Share This

item.title: John Key DVD - Director’s cut
item.description:
John Key is the epitome of "style over substance" and his DVD showed us just how desperately he wants to be everything to everyone.

This Production Shed.TV user-submitted video explores the man behind the mask.
